column4: Hi. I installed a sata harddrive from one pc to a new one. the old one had a nvidia vga chip. now the new one runs an intel chip. how to change the driver to intel that system runs properly? Ubuntu 10.04 lts
did you use the nvidia restricted drivers?
at the old hardware yes. now in the new hardware is an intel chipset.
you want to uninstall the nvidia drivers then
yes, i want to uninstall the nvidia drivers and install the intel drivers.
boot with safe graphics mode then use restricted driver manager to uninstall the driver
it is booted in safe graphics mode. now in restricted driver manager it is nothing shown...
Failed to load module "pk-gtk-module": libpk-gtk-module.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
is it possible to change driver in xorg.conf by hand?
how do i disable an upstart conf? just uncomment the "start on" line? what's the preferred way?
i will move than the xorg.conf to another name. and after that? reboot?
backing it up is probably better :-)
thank you. now i restart and try... see you later
